timeline.title: Early Mechanization
timeline.description: Water wheels, along with wheels and early gears, assisted and replaced the labor of many humans and animals but didn't completely revolutionize work.

timeline.title: Steam Engine
timeline.description: The invention of the steam engine kickstarted the industrial revoltion greatly augmenting and expanding the potential of physical effort.

timeline.title: Start of trueAutomation
timeline.description: Ford Montors began fully automating tasks, with machines not only augmenting physical effort but also taking over tasks, taking in feedback, and self adjusting to feedback.
